FOTO: Pred martinovim so nazdravili s pubeci
Mlada štajerska vina, združena pod imenom Pubec, so že peto leto zapovrstjo navdušila Mariborčane, danes bodo še Ljubljančane.
07 Nov 2019, 10:07 by Aleš Andlovič



Na prireditvi Pubec se je v Mariboru zbralo približno 1000 obiskovalcev. FOTO: Aleš Andlovič



Borut in Natalija Cvetko sta zaslužna za pubece. FOTO: Mediaspeed.net



Predstavilo se je 25 ponudnikov suhih in polsuhih mladih vin letošnje trgatve. FOTO: Mediaspeed.net



Letošnja vinska kraljica, 23-letna Meta Frangež FOTO: Mediaspeed.net



Seveda je bilo poskrbljeno tudi za glasbo. FOTO: Mediaspeed.net



Filip Flisar je prišel v družbi prijatelja Domna Jaunika, ki že prevzema domačo vinogradniško kmetijo. FOTO: Mediaspeed.net



Jurij in Slavica Cvitanič FOTO: Mediaspeed.net


Kar 25 jih je stalo v dolgi vrsti v mariborskem avtomobilskem salonu Porsche na Ptujski cesti. Vsi moški, opremljeni s prepoznavnim metuljčkom, zaščitnim znakom znamke Pubec, ki sta jo na svet potegnila Borut in Natalija Cvetko. Sicer strastna lastnika fotografske agencije se predvsem zadnja leta lotevata novih podvigov. »Število ponudnikov se je ustalilo. Zaupajo nam tisti, ki poznajo koncept in prodornost zgodbe. Razumemo, da se nekateri odločijo za drugo pot, a spoznavamo, da so del zgodbe predvsem mladi vinogradniki in prevzemniki, ki razumejo pomembnost povezovanja in marketinga. Poistovetili so se z znamko, odraščajo z njo, tudi s starši. Slikajo se za kataloge, plakate, objavijo produkte na družabnih omrežjih, kar vsem koristi. Ponosni so, da so pubeci. In imajo razlog za to,« razvoj ocenjuje Cvetkova.
Iz vinogradniških družin
Pogled na 25 ponudnikov suhih in polsuhih mladih vin letošnje trgatve je potrdil tezo organizatorke že petega salona. Veliko mladih obrazov je bilo videti za improviziranim točilnim pultom, večinoma hčera ali sinov sicer znanih štajerskih vinogradnikov. Seveda je v množici izstopala letošnja vinska kraljica, 23-letna Meta Frangež iz Hercegovščaka. Pa ne samo s svojim mladim vinom, ki sta ga pridelala z očetom Jernejem Frangežem, ampak tudi z videzom in očarljivim pogledom, ki sta vse bolj potrjevala pravilnost izbire žirantov na letošnjem izboru za vinsko kraljico. Seveda na mariborskem delu letošnjega Pubeca ni manjkala ministrica za kmetijstvo dr. Aleksandra Pivec, ki je navdušena zapuščala štajersko prestolnico: »Imamo izrazito razvito kulturo pitja vina, imamo vrhunska vina, s katerimi se lahko promoviramo ne le v Sloveniji, ampak tudi zunaj naših meja.« Danes bodo mladi štajerski vinarke in vinarji gostovali še v prestolnici, ko bodo ob 17. uri začeli svojo predstavitev v Festivalni dvorani.
Dobro vino ima zgodbo
Znanih obrazov je bilo veliko, med njimi pa smo pogrešali mariborskega župana Sašo Arsenovića, čeprav bi kot stari gostinec moral sodelovati na tovrstnih prireditvah. Zato pa sta izstopala dva znana mariborska obraza – pevec Domen Kumer in smučar prostega sloga Filip Flisar. Medtem ko je Kumer spominjal na legendarnega pevca iz šestdesetih in sedemdesetih let Elvisa Presleyja, je Flisar tokrat nastopal brez svoje izbranke Monike. Ob bok si je postavil prijatelja s smučarskih strmin Domna Jaunika. Ta namreč spada med tiste, ki postajajo sinonim za znamko Pubec – mladenič pri rosnih srednjih dvajsetih prevzema vinogradniško kmetijo Jaunik v Limbušu in se je letos prvič predstavil med izbranimi pubeci. »Dobra priložnost, da se pokažeš širšemu krogu ljudi,« pravi Domen.In tam je bil tudi Jurij Cvitanič iz Zamušanov pri Gorišnici, čigar dedek se je pred 75 leti z Brača preselil na Koroško, hkrati pa kupil še vinograd, zidanico in posestvo: »V vinogradništvu megle ne moreš prodajati. Vino mora biti dobro in zato so pomembne tudi obrobne zgodbe.« Mlado vino jurček, zvrst iz petih sort, je poimenovano po vnuku, že peti generaciji Jurijev v družini. Jurij se nadeja, da se bo tudi nova generacija zapisala vinogradništvu.

PHOTO: Before Martin's they were toasted with pubes
The young Styrian wines, united under the name Pubec, have impressed Mariborians for the fifth consecutive year, and today they will still be Ljubljana residents.
07 Nov 2019, 10:07 by Aleš Andlovich



About 1000 visitors gathered at the Pubec event in Maribor. PHOTO: Ales Andlovich



Borut and Natalia Cvetko deserve publicity. PHOTO: Mediaspeed.net



25 winners of dry and semi-dry young wines presented this year's harvest. PHOTO: Mediaspeed.net



This year's Wine Queen, 23-year-old Meta Frangez PHOTO: Mediaspeed.net



Of course, music was also taken care of. PHOTO: Mediaspeed.net



Filip Flisar came in the company of his friend Dom Jaunik, who is already taking over the home winery. PHOTO: Mediaspeed.net



Yuri and Slavica Cvitanic PHOTO: Mediaspeed.net


As many as 25 cost a long queue at the Porsche Maribor Motor Show on Ptujska Street. All men, equipped with the distinctive butterfly, the Pubec trademark, which Borut and Natalia Cvetko have drawn to the world. Otherwise, passionate owners of the photographic agency have been embarking on new ventures in recent years. “The number of providers has stabilized. We are trusted by those who know the concept and pervasiveness of the story. We understand that some people choose the second path, but we realize that part of the story is primarily young winegrowers and transferees who understand the importance of networking and marketing. They identified with the brand, growing up with it, including their parents. They take pictures for catalogs, posters, post products on social networks, which benefits everyone. They are proud to be pubescent. And they have a reason for that, "Cvetkova estimates.
From vineyard families
A look at 25 providers of dry and semi-dry young wines of this year's vintage confirmed the thesis of the organizer of the fifth salon. Many young faces were seen behind the makeshift bar, mostly daughters or sons of otherwise famous Styrian winemakers. Of course, this year's wine queen, 23-year-old Meta Frangež from Herzegovinian, stood out in the crowd. Not only with their young wine, which they produced with their father Jerne Frangež, but also with their appearance and charming look, which increasingly confirmed the correctness of the choice of guarantors at this year's wine queen selection. Of course, the Minister of Agriculture, Dr. Alexandra Pivec, who was enthusiastically leaving the Styrian capital: "We have a highly developed culture of drinking wine, we have top-quality wines that can be promoted not only in Slovenia but also beyond our borders." Today, young Styrian winemakers and winemakers will also visit the capital. when they begin their presentation at the Festival Hall at 5pm.
Good wine has a story
There were many famous faces, but we missed the mayor of Maribor, Saša Arsenović, although as an old caterer he would have to participate in such events. That's why two famous Maribor faces stood out - singer Domen Kumer and freestyle skier Filip Flisar. While Kumer was reminiscent of the legendary singer of the 1960s and 1970s, Elvis Presley, Flisar performed this time without his chosen Monica. He put a friend of ski slopes, Dom Jaunik, by his side. He is one of those who become synonymous with the Pubec brand - a young man in his mid-twenties who takes over the Jaunik winery in Limbu and for the first time introduced himself to selected pubs. "A good opportunity to show yourself to a wider audience," says Domen.And there was Jurij Cvitanič from Zamušani near Gorišnica, whose grandfather moved from Brač 75 years ago to Carinthia, and at the same time bought a vineyard, vineyard and estate: “You cannot sell fog in the vineyard. The wine has to be good and that is why the marginal stories are important. ”The young wine is a soup, a genre of five varieties, named after its grandson, the fifth generation of Yuri in the family. Yuri hopes that a new generation will also make a name for the wine industry.
